snippet: The settlement over a development plan in Mount Holly, N.J., will leave open the question of whether claims under the Fair Housing Act require proof of intentional discrimination.
abstract: Parties settle housing discrimination case concerning development plan in Mount Holly, NJ, before its scheduled hearing before Supreme Court; civil rights groups, wary of a Supreme Court ruling that they feared could weaken protections for victims of housing discrimination, welcome the development.
lead_paragraph: The settlement over a development plan in Mount Holly, N.J., will leave open the question of whether claims under the Fair Housing Act require proof of intentional discrimination.

headline.main: Fair-Housing Case Is Settled Before It Reaches Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Housing Case Is Settled Before It Goes to Supreme Court
